title: What are the natural rights with which people are born, according to John Locke? - Quora

response.answer_text: Life, liberty and property. The reasons for that were only vaguely understood by philosophers throughout history. Rights have rarely been distinguished from privileges. And the source has typically been imagined to be some magical god or a society with mystical powers. Most explanations are a tangled web of nonsense. No one has been able to provide a simple, easy to understand explanation. Until Ayn Rand. She explained how they are “requirements for survival”. But even with Rand, you have to dig for it. I can save everyone that trouble. Here: #1 Inalienable Rights, Where Do They Come From?
